Open call from UNESCO for experts on culture in developing countries
57-Web home page (text, logo, image of a department)

Through means of an expert facility, funded by the European Union, UNESCO aims to strengthen systems of governance in developing countries. Interested individuals have until 20 March (midnight CET) to apply.

The expert facility supports capacity development initiatives for the implementation of the 2005 Convention on the Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions.

The open call will refresh and diversify the expert facility to ensure all world regions are well-represented and that the right kind of expertise is involved.

European Union backing for the project comes as part of its support for culture in developing countries.

The expert facility will deliver country-level assistance in areas such as cultural diversity and cultural expression, among others.

This will be achieved through a variety of means such as organising workshops, capacity-building interventions, coaching and more.

UNESCO is looking for applicants with at least 10 years of experience in the cultural and creative industries.

Candidates specialising in the following areas are particularly sought:

  • cultural statistics and indicators
  • trade
  • digitisation
  • media diversity
  • status of the artist and freedom of artistic expression
  • preferential treatment and mobility

Potential applicants may be:

  • civil servants
  • governmental experts
  • cultural operators
  • managers of cultural institutions or associations
  • researchers
  • academics and/or independent experts

UNESCO emphasises that female candidates and candidates from Africa, Arab States and the Asia-Pacific regions are strongly encouraged to apply. The deadline is 20 March (midnight CET).
